concept.title: N1QL Language Reference
concept.shortdesc: The N1QL reference guide describes the N1QL language structure, syntax, and shows how to run N1QL queries from a command line. It also provides reference information about the basic elements in N1QL which can be combined to build N1QL statements.

section.title: N1QL Language Structure
section.p: The N1QL language structure is composed of statements, expressions, and comments.

dlentry.dd:
N1QL statements are categorized into the following groups:
Data Definition Language (DDL) statements to create, modify, and delete indexes.
Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements to select from, insert, update, delete, and upsert data into JSON documents.

The following are the different types of N1QL expressions:
literal-value
identifier
nested expression
case
logical
comparison
arithmetic
concatenation
construction
function call
subquery
collection
N1QL supports block comments. Here is the syntax: /* [[text] | [newline]]+ */

section.title: Nested Path Expressions
section.p: In N1QL, nested paths indicate an expression to access nested sub-documents within a JSON document or expression.
For example, the latitude of a location in the type ="airport" documents in the `travel-sample` are in the geo sub-document and can be addressed as the nested path `travel-sample`.geo.lat:
A dot (.) notation is used to access sub-document fields within a document.
